metadata.title: CVE-2020-6831 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow could occur when parsing and validating SCTP chunks inWebRTC. This could have led to memory corruption and a potentiallyexploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.8, Firefox <76, and Thunderbird < 68.8.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6831` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

chromium-browser - 81.0.4044.138-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
